grade.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a particular level of quality that a product, material etc has
grade.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The best grades of tea are expensive.
grade.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: There are lots of jobs in junior grades.
grade.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a mark that a student is given for their work or for an examination
grade.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: He got a grade A in maths.
Tim worked hard and got good grades.
grade.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: one of the 12 years that students are at school in the American school system, or the students in a particular year
grade.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: My brother is in sixth grade.
grade.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a slope or a degree of slope, especially in a road or railway
grade.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: â€“ Meaning 3: a mark that a student is given for their work or for an examination
grade.translation[0].note_box[0].section: If you study hard, you get good grades, and you get into good schools.
If you get a bad grade, Mrs. Miller will help you until you can do better.
She got high grades in all her science subjects.
These boys receive low grades because they fail to turn in assignments.
Ted got the top grade in his A-level maths exam.
Applicants must have Grade A, B, or C in two GCSE subjects.
He had always gotten good grades.
Rick had achieved good exam grades.
grade.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to say what level of a quality something has, or what standard it is
grade.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: All the parks are regularly checked and graded by tourist board inspectors.
Pencils are graded according to softness.
grade.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to give a mark to an examination paper or to a piece of school work
grade.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Ted is grading papers in his office.
grade.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to give a particular rank and level of pay to a job
grade.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a particular level of quality that a product, material etc has
grade.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The best grades of tea are expensive.
grade.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: Staff from ethnic minorities were not being promoted beyond junior grades.
grade.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to judge something and say officially what its size or quality is
grade.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: All the parks are regularly checked and graded by tourist board inspectors.
